bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 4 (Monday, January 8, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ZELDIN:H.R. 4741.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8 of the United States Constitution.____________________[Page H18]

item.title: A bill to require the United States Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP code for particular communities.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

summary.text: This bill requires the U.S. Postal Service to designate a single, unique ZIP code for the communities of Flanders, Northampton, and Riverside in the Town of Southampton, New York.

bill.title: To require the Postmaster General to designate a single, unique ZIP code for particular communities, and for other purposes.

item.title: To require the Postmaster General to designate a single, unique ZIP code for particular communities, and for other purposes.
To require the Postmaster General to designate a single, unique ZIP code for particular communities, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
